title: Banner, ca. 1917
medium:
Medium: wool, cotton
Technique: machine embroidery and applique
description: Red-orange rectangular banner with a navy blue arch across the top with white letters that reads: "Over There." Underneath the arch is an embroidered white rectangle with a navy blue five-pointed star in the center. A metal rod with a hook holds the piece at the top. This piece was hung in the window of a home to denote that the family had a son in the U.S. military fighting in World War I.

tombstone.epitaph:
Banner, ca. 1917.Medium: wool, cotton
Technique: machine embroidery and applique. 1977-34-1.
